reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

description.narrative: The proposed project entails organizing and holding a conference for at least 80 participants drawn from various countries backgrounds experiences and expertise relevant to enhancing faster growth and the ability of sustainable forestry to compete with gro wing forest products demands in East AfricaThe introduction and development of good quality planting material is central to improving the competitiveness of the forestry sector in East Africa to enable faster growth and sustainable forestry. Besides this, the region requires maximum contributions and collaboration from public and private sector stakeholders. The above conference will achieve this by bringing together scientist experts entrepreneurs policy makers and practitioners to develop consensus on res pective roles and responsibilities towards a competitive and sustainable forestry sector in East Africa. The main product of the conference will be a regional tree improvement strategy.The project aims to contribute to the overall goal: ?Towards enhancing competitiveness of forestry sector in East Africa through a sustainable tree improvement programme?Conference Objectives? To review tree improvement research and development initiatives in East Africa? To bring together forestry stakeholders to share exper iences and identify needs? To map out a regional strategy for tree improvement? To explore models of sustainable resourcing for tree improvement programmesAt the end of the conference a strategic action plan will be drawn with measurable targets indicators timelines and specific roles/contributions by partners towards successful Tree improvement programme in East Africa.Thereafter each country can then apply the principles of the strategy to their national individual priorities and situations.
